CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bernice Childs, 2855 Vincennes Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1958, pg. A1, with question: "Do you approve of women bartenders?" answer reads: "I don't approve of women bartenders because it does not look ladylike."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bernice Childs, wearing head scarf and coat, holding dark handbag, standing on Liberty Avenue with pedestrians, automobiles, and May Building with sign reading "Drugs" in background, Downtown
